message_1:
Suppose that there are three different states that a system can be in. The probabilities of transitioning from state $i$ to state $j$ after one step are given by the following matrix:

$$
\begin{pmatrix}
0.2 & 0.8 & 0\\
0.1 & 0.4 & 0.5\\
0.3 & 0.6 & 0.1\\
\end{pmatrix},
$$

where the rows represent the initial states and the columns represent the final states. If the system is currently in state 1, what's the probability that it will be in state 3 after two steps?
message_2:
To find the probability of being in state 3 after two steps, we need to square the given transition matrix. Let's call the given matrix P:

$$
P = \begin{pmatrix}
0.2 & 0.8 & 0\\
0.1 & 0.4 & 0.5\\
0.3 & 0.6 & 0.1\\
\end{pmatrix}
$$

Now, we need to find the matrix product $P^2 = P \times P$:

$$
P^2 = \begin{pmatrix}
0.2 & 0.8 & 0\\
0.1 & 0.4 & 0.5\\
0.3 & 0.6 & 0.1\\
\end{pmatrix}
\times
\begin{pmatrix}
0.2 & 0.8 & 0\\
0.1 & 0.4 & 0.5\\
0.3 & 0.6 & 0.1\\
\end{pmatrix}
$$

$$
P^2 = \begin{pmatrix}
(0.2)(0.2) + (0.8)(0.1) + (0)(0.3) & (0.2)(0.8) + (0.8)(0.4) + (0)(0.6) & (0.2)(0) + (0.8)(0.5) + (0)(0.1)\\
(0.1)(0.2) + (0.4)(0.1) + (0.5)(0.3) & (0.1)(0.8) + (0.4)(0.4) + (0.5)(0.6) & (0.1)(0) + (0.4)(0.5) + (0.5)(0.1)\\
(0.3)(0.2) + (0.6)(0.1) + (0.1)(0.3) & (0.3)(0.8) + (0.6)(0.4) + (0.1)(0.6) & (0.3)(0) + (0.6)(0.5) + (0.1)(0.1)\\
\end{pmatrix}
$$

$$
P^2 = \begin{pmatrix}
0.04 + 0.08 + 0 & 0.16 + 0.32 + 0 & 0 + 0.4 + 0\\
0.02 + 0.04 + 0.15 & 0.08 + 0.16 + 0.3 & 0 + 0.2 + 0.05\\
0.06 + 0.06 + 0.03 & 0.24 + 0.24 + 0.06 & 0 + 0.3 + 0.01\\
\end{pmatrix}
$$

$$
P^2 = \begin{pmatrix}
0.12 & 0.48 & 0.4\\
0.21 & 0.54 & 0.25\\
0.15 & 0.54 & 0.31\\
\end{pmatrix}
$$

Now, to find the probability of being in state 3 after two steps, we look at the entry in row 1 (since we start in state 1) and column 3 (since we want to end in state 3):

$$
P^2_{13} = 0.4
$$

So, the probability that the system will be in state 3 after two steps is 0.4 or 40%.
